settings.question: Who is Gush?
settings.answer:
"Gush makes innovative materials for the built environment. Beyond sprucing up your home, our products support your wellbeing and help the Earth too.
We believe your choices, however small, can drive purposeful change. When we bring our actions together, big or small – we’re walking the path of true wellness. If this resonates with you, come be a part of our community.

For more information about our mission, click here. "

settings.question:
"I am a partner/ Influencer, 
how can I collaborate with you? "
settings.answer: We love working on shared ideas, and can’t wait to hear yours. You may reach out to us at hello@gowithgush.com.

settings.question:
I’m interested in a career at Gush, 
where can I apply?
settings.answer: Visit our Hiring page to check out our currently available positions.

settings.question: Do you have a physical store where I can walk in and make a purchase from?
settings.answer: No, we don’t have a physical store. But if you need information or want to place an order, you can get in touch by phone, Whatsapp or email. Check out our contact page here for more details.

settings.question: Where can I see your colours in person?
settings.answer:
"You may visit us at our office at 2 Gambas Crescent, #01-35, Nordcom II, Singapore 757044, with an appointment. Please call us at 6692 9000 to arrange an appointment. 

Visiting hours: 
Mon – Fri, except for P.Hs. 
9am - 12pm, 1pm – 5pm
"

settings.question: How can I contact Gush?
settings.answer: You can send us an email at hello@gowithgush.com, or contact us via Whatsapp by using the ‘Chat’ button on our website.

settings.question: What’s the difference between Air-purifying and Washable interior paint?
settings.answer:
Both paints remove pollutants and have anti-molding capabilities, but the paint types each have their own unique feature.

Gush Air-purifying paint has a humidity control feature that maintains a healthy moisture level in your room.

Gush Washable paint lets you easily wipe off grime from your surfaces without damaging the paint coat. 

We recommend using the Air-purifying interior paint for ceilings or areas with a lot of moisture, and the Washable option for walls and areas prone to dirt, stains and marks.

settings.question: Is your full colour range available on your website?
settings.answer: No, our website only features 65 curated colours. If you’re looking for a colour that is not on our website, please reach out to us at hello@gowithgush.com.

settings.question: I've just got my walls painted. The colour appears to be darker in comparison to what's shown on your website.
settings.answer: While we’ve done our best to represent our colours accurately online, colour presentations can vary depending on the monitor and screen settings. To help in your decision-making, we recommend ordering our sample tubs to confirm your colour choice before proceeding with your paint order. This not only shows you the exact colour, but helps you visualise how it’s going to look on your wall.

settings.question: How much paint should I get?
settings.answer:
"You’ll get a good gauge using our handy Paint Calculator here*.
But as a general estimate, 1 litre of gush paint gets you 2 coats for a 5-6 m² surface area, approximately. 
*Kindly note that the calculated quantity may differ for your home, based on how many walls you’ll be painting."

settings.question: Do you provide colour books?
settings.answer: We don’t have a colour book for our online range, but you can get the sample tubs of the colours you’re interested in. You can do so by selecting ‘Sample’ under the product listing.

settings.question: Is it safe to stay in the house while the painting is done?
settings.answer: Yes, that’s the beauty of using our odourless, toxic-free paints. It’s safe for pregnant women and children to stay as well. You can stay in another room while the painting is done, so the wet walls don’t get touched.

settings.question: Is the paint safe for people with asthma or respiratory illnesses?
settings.answer: Yes, Gush paints are odourless and do not emit any toxic fumes.

settings.question: Do I have to use a white base first if I am painting a dark-coloured wall with a lighter colour?
settings.answer: We recommend applying a layer of sealer instead. Besides already being white in colour, the sealer helps your paint coat bind to the wall better and prevents cracking and peeling.

settings.question: Is it advisable to strip the old paint every time I want to repaint?
settings.answer: We do not recommend stripping off old paint as this would worsen the wall condition. Your best bet is to get a professional plastering service to repair the wall before you repaint it.

settings.question: I am looking to paint on wood surfaces. Which paint would be a better choice – Air-Purifying or Washable paint?
settings.answer:
"Currently, our paints are not ideal for wood surfaces as they are water-based with matte-finishing. When applied to wood, it might cause scratches, dirt marks or peel over time. We recommend using other oil or latex-based paints instead.
If you still wish to use our paints on wood, make sure to apply a layer of sealer first to get the best result."

settings.question: Can I use a sealer from another brand together with Gush Air-purifying paint?
settings.answer: Yes, that’s possible. But our interior paints still give the best results when paired with the Gush sealer.

settings.question: What material surface can Gush Air-purifying interior paint be applied to?
settings.answer:
Wood
Application on wooden surfaces is possible, but not recommended. Our paint is unable to replicate the natural beauty of wooden surfaces due to its matte-texture finish. If you wish to paint gush on wood, do apply a layer of sealer first.

Plastic
Application on plastic surfaces is possible, but not recommended. If you wish to paint gush on plastic, apply a layer of sealer first to help the paint coat bind to the surface better.

Metal
Gush interior paints should not be applied to metal surfaces as it is a water-based, latex paint that may cause the metal surface to rust.

Exterior walls
It should not be used as a replacement for exterior paint. As Gush interior paints are specifically formulated for interior environments, they do not perform the same in outdoor conditions.

settings.question: Do I mix need to mix water with my paints?
settings.answer:
No, you don’t need to. Adding too much water will reduce our paints’ air-purifying effectiveness and finish. Give the paint a thorough stir before use so that the pigments are evenly mixed, and you’re good to go.
If the paint is too sticky for you, you can dilute it with water, but just a little. The amount of water you add should not exceed 15% of the overall paint solution as this would severely reduce the paints’ efficacy. Only use clean water so the paint doesn’t get contaminated.
